author: n3tsurge
description: This capability involves establishing the ability to remove files within a system or network. This includes implementing mechanisms to delete files securely, ensuring that all traces of the files are removed and cannot be recovered. It is essential for maintaining data integrity, compliance with regulations, and enhancing overall security posture by providing a controlled method for file deletion.

requirements.description: Staff must be trained and qualified to perform this capability effectively.
Documented procedures and playbooks must be available for executing this capability.
File system access and forensic tools for file analysis and manipulation.

title: Establish Ability to Remove File

references.name: NIST SP 800-61 Rev. 2: Incident Response Preparation
SANS: Incident Response Team Development and Preparation
